post_text:
Sesame Street Town Hall, Saturday, 6/6 @ 9:00 am

As anger and heartbreak have swept across America over the killing of yet another black man at the hands of police, CNN and "Sesame Street" are refocusing their second town hall to address racism.

The 60-minute special "Coming Together: Standing Up to Racism. A CNN/Sesame Street Town Hall for Kids and Families" will air on Saturday, June 6, at 9 a.m. CST.
The show will talk to kids about racism, the recent nationwide protests, embracing diversity and being more empathetic and understanding.
Big Bird will join CNN commentator Van Jones and CNN anchor and national correspondent Erica Hill to moderate the event. They will be joined by "Sesame Street" characters -- including Elmo, Abby Cadabby and Rosita -- and other experts answering questions submitted by families.
text:
Sesame Street Town Hall, Saturday, 6/6 @ 9:00 am

As anger and heartbreak have swept across America over the killing of yet another black man at the hands of police, CNN and "Sesame Street" are refocusing their second town hall to address racism.

The 60-minute special "Coming Together: Standing Up to Racism. A CNN/Sesame Street Town Hall for Kids and Families" will air on Saturday, June 6, at 9 a.m. CST.
The show will talk to kids about racism, the recent nationwide protests, embracing diversity and being more empathetic and understanding.
Big Bird will join CNN commentator Van Jones and CNN anchor and national correspondent Erica Hill to moderate the event. They will be joined by "Sesame Street" characters -- including Elmo, Abby Cadabby and Rosita -- and other experts answering questions submitted by families.

post_text:
Message for Parents:

Good Morning,

Due to the Novel Coronavirus, aka COVID-19 Pandemic, the decision has been made for our school, Hope Leadership Academy, to be closed through April 3, 2020.

At this time, we are expecting our scholars to return to school on Monday, April 6, 2020.

More information will be shared with our parent community later this week regarding instructional resources and tips to share with our scholars during this extended break.

Robert N. Milner

Join the KCUYA this summer for a free Science of Baseball Summer Camp for 3rd-6th grade students from June 10-13 and June 17-20! This educational camp will help students make better connections between baseball and STEM topics as they see it come to life through hands-on activities.

Limited spots are available. See flyer for more information!

post_text: After TK does their greeting during Morning Meeting, it's time for sharing. We sing about the classroom rules, and then discuss ways we can respect self, others, and property. After that, each person has the opportunity to share how they are feeling that day.
text: After TK does their greeting during Morning Meeting, it's time for sharing. We sing about the classroom rules, and then discuss ways we can respect self, others, and property. After that, each person has the opportunity to share how they are feeling that day.

post_text: Every day, TK participates in Morning Meeting. So many life skills are learned in this short amount of time. We start each meeting with a greeting in order to make everyone feel welcome. Sometimes it's a chant or a song, and sometimes it's a hug, handshake, or a high-five.

post_text: Hope Leadership Academy earned 91.4% of APR points, an increase from 2017’s score of 70%. This is the result of hard work by our teachers, students, and families. We increased from 75% to 100% of Mathematic points and from 0% to 60% of Attendance points. Keep up the great work!

post_text: First Graders and Ms. London experiencing Nick Cave's Hye Dive art installation. This exhibit is located next to our school in The Hope Center's building (a former church). The exhibit is open to the public for viewing Tuesday- Sunday 10am-6pm through October 29th.

post_text:
Playdough! It's an age-old favorite of kids and adults alike. For young children, it is also an important tool in helping strengthen finger muscles. Fine motor skills are crucial when it comes to writing and drawing, tying shoes, buttoning buttons, etc. Read more about the power of playdough from the National Association for the Education of Young Children.

https://www.naeyc.org/our-work/families/playdough-power

post_text:
According the National Commission on Reading, the single most significant factor influencing a child’s early educational success is an introduction to books and being read to at home prior to beginning school. How often do you read to your kids at home?

#kansascity #reading #literacy #hlafalcons #kcschools

post_text:
Do you know that children and adolescents should do 60 minutes (1 hour) or more of physical activity daily? Let's get our kids out and moving by doing some of these activities together:
* bike riding
* walking
* running
* dancing
* playing tag, soccer, basketball
